displaytitle: North side of East end of St. Paul's: background study for Latimer Preaching at St. Paul's Cross
creditline: Gift of George L. Small, Class of 1943
inscribed: in graphite, lower right: The spaces between the Buttresses vary | considerably in Dugdale. | G.H.
signed: Titled, inscribed, signed, and dated in graphite, lower center: North side of East End of St. Pauls | before the fire 1666. Dugdale B.M. G.H. 4.9.51

titles.title: North Side of East End of St. Paul's, after Dugdale, The History of St. Paul's Cathedral in London

Album containing 99 original drawings and 87 architecture, portrait, and costume studies of a documentary nature for the paintings Latimer Preaching at Paul's Cross and The Martyrdom of Ridley and Latimer.

makers.displaymaker: Sir George Hayter, 1792–1871; born and died London, England
